comments_with_keywords.comment: Module for all arguments to the CLI application. The argument initializes the OptionParser, which defines the arguments in detail. It is also nested with a function that adds all arguments from modules.
comments_with_keywords.name: Arguments

comments_with_keywords.comment: Options is a get method and gets all options from arguments.
comments_with_keywords.name: self.options

comments_with_keywords.comment: It finds out if the plugin is written in the argument.
comments_with_keywords.name: self.active_plugin?

comments_with_keywords.comment: This is the module that handles plugins so that they are found, imported and inizialized.
comments_with_keywords.name: Plugins

comments_with_keywords.comment: Finds all init.rb files in the plugins folder. Otherwise, the absolute path is determined by the Dir.pwd() method.
comments_with_keywords.name: find_all_init(path = Dir.pwd)

comments_with_keywords.comment: Imports all found init.rb files into Ruby script. Returns the classes that are imported, otherwise returns an empty array.
comments_with_keywords.name: require_all_init()

comments_with_keywords.comment: Adds a plugin argument and initializes its nested arguments. It chooses the name and description of the argument to be the one written on behalf of the plugin,  which is found from the RJSV::Plugin class.
comments_with_keywords.name: add_arguments(parser)

comments_with_keywords.comment: Dedicated to all signals for Unix system. Here we find the signal for INT.
comments_with_keywords.name: Signals

comments_with_keywords.comment: Here are the code blocks that are activated when the main function is triggered. Functions communicate using arguments passed via the command line, which are passed as options_cli. These functions include translate and watch, which can be reused when creating custom plugins.
comments_with_keywords.name: States

comments_with_keywords.comment: Block of code that handles the transpilation of script. This is opening a Ruby script container file, which is then converted into a JavaScript file. The file is saved to the output path.
comments_with_keywords.name: translate_state(path, options_cli)

comments_with_keywords.comment: Block of code that tracks files under the input path. If a file has been logged, several events are performed such as to add, modify and remove logged files. These then trigger procedural methods to process the requests.
comments_with_keywords.name: watch_state(options_cli)

comments_with_keywords.comment: All constant variables.
comments_with_keywords.name: Constants

comments_with_keywords.comment: The module is reserved for handling classes and modules. Thus, it is a manipulation of constant keywords.
comments_with_keywords.name: Constants

comments_with_keywords.comment: This method tries to find already initialized classes from the mod (module) using the abstract class RJSV::Plugin. It returns an array of classes.
comments_with_keywords.name: get_classes(mod)

comments_with_keywords.comment: Event module for handling fifo events. This is so far a module for just the basic event printing element.
comments_with_keywords.name: Event

comments_with_keywords.comment: Prints an event type using the puts() method that shows the time, cli application name, event and event message.
comments_with_keywords.name: print(event, message = "")

comments_with_keywords.comment: The file module ensures safe handling of files. It always checks if a file really exists on the input path or if a certain folder exists on the output path. It can also change the absolute path or find all necessary files for further manipulation.
comments_with_keywords.name: Files

comments_with_keywords.comment: Opens the file securely and returns the content from the file. If the file does not exist, it returns nil.
comments_with_keywords.name: open(path)

comments_with_keywords.comment: Stores the file with the assigned container by safely discovering its folder and, if necessary, creating it when it does not exist in the path. It can also be assigned a file write mode.
comments_with_keywords.name: write_with_dir(content, path, mode = 'w+')

comments_with_keywords.comment: Safely removes the file from the path. If the file is the last one in the folder, the folder is also deleted with the file.
comments_with_keywords.name: remove(path)

comments_with_keywords.comment: The method is special in that it examines arguments from the CLI and modifies the definition path for the output path.
comments_with_keywords.name: change_path_to_output(path, options_cli)

comments_with_keywords.comment: Finds all files with the extension '.*.rb' from the defined path.
comments_with_keywords.name: find_all(path)

comments_with_keywords.comment: Copies all files from the input path to the output path. This is a method that copies all files even those that are invisible to the UNIX system (dot file).
comments_with_keywords.name: copy(path_input, path_output)

comments_with_keywords.comment: Abstract 'class' for creating initialization plagins. They are teachable for defining basic information and is the starting point for triggering functions using the init() function. If we are creating a custom plugin, we need to inherit this 'class' into its own 'class'.
comments_with_keywords.name: Plugin

comments_with_keywords.comment: Description of the plugin that is printed to the CLI during help.
comments_with_keywords.name: description

comments_with_keywords.comment: This function is not mandatory and automatically defines the 'module' name according to the plugin 'module'.
comments_with_keywords.name: name

comments_with_keywords.comment: The method should pass an initialization method for all arguments of this plugin.
comments_with_keywords.name: arguments

comments_with_keywords.comment: The method that is the main initialization block for the code that the plugin should execute.
comments_with_keywords.name: init

comments_with_keywords.comment: A private method that raises an error message about an abstract class with a function name.
comments_with_keywords.name: abstract_error(fn_name)

comments_with_keywords.comment: Here we can load everything necessary for the transpilation process of Ruby script into JavaScript. The transpilation process uses the Ruby2JS library. The transpilation is safe and catches error messages if the Ruby script has been written incorrectly.
comments_with_keywords.name: Translate

comments_with_keywords.comment: Converts Ruby script to JavaScript using Ruby2JS library. If an error occurs during transpilation, the error message is raised in the next nested code block.
comments_with_keywords.name: ruby_to_js(content_ruby, &block)

comments_with_keywords.comment: Converts Ruby script to JavaScript using Ruby2JS library. The final transpilation is followed by saving it to a file with a predefined path.
comments_with_keywords.name: ruby_to_js_with_write(content_ruby, path, &block)

comments_with_keywords.comment: Module for real-time monitoring of files on the local disk. It uses the 'listen' library for this function. There is only one method that can be loaded here which triggers everything.
comments_with_keywords.name: Watch

comments_with_keywords.comment: Tracks modified files in the path that is defined as the source directory. When this function is called, the event listener is triggered for events such as modified, added, and deleted file events. Therefore, the method can put the application to sleep and silently monitor the event process. It watches all files with extension '.*.rb', which asterisk means any sub extension such as '.js'.
comments_with_keywords.name: modified_files(path, &block)

comments_with_keywords.comment: This is the main initialization module of all modules that are needed for the functionality of this RubyJS-Vite transpiler. The methods that shape the direction of the application are also written here.
comments_with_keywords.name: RJSV

comments_with_keywords.comment: This is the main function to run the desired block function scenarios. In order to arm itself regarding plugins and directly Arguments, this method checks the accessibility of the plugin by checking if it is active or attached in the argument given by the confirmed command from the terminal.
comments_with_keywords.name: main()
